thread.title: AC Milan considering 27m summer bid for Chelsea midfielder Cesc Fabregas
thread.title_full: AC Milan considering 27m summer bid for Chelsea midfielder Cesc Fabregas

title: AC Milan considering 27m summer bid for Chelsea midfielder Cesc Fabregas
text:
AC Milan considering £27m summer bid for Chelsea midfielder Cesc Fabregas AC Milan are understood to be keen on signing Chelsea midfielder Cesc Fàbregas Credit: REX FEATURES Matt Law , Football News Correspondent 27 February 2017 • 2:04pm 
A C Milan will try to tempt Chelsea into selling Cesc Fàbregas with a ‘money back’ offer in the summer, despite the midfielder’s preference to stay at Stamford Bridge. 
And Manchester United manager Jose Mourinho is also keeping a close eye on the situation of Fàbregas in case Chelsea agree to cash in on the Spaniard. 
Fàbregas scored one goal and made another on his 300th Premier League game at the weekend to underline his value to Chelsea in a season in which he has spent long spells on the substitutes’ bench. 
The 29-year-old rejected opportunities leave Chelsea in January and reiterated his desire to stay at the club this summer after the victory over Swansea City . 
But AC Milan, who are finally set to confirm the takeover of the club by Chinese investors, are ready to step up their interest in Fàbregas. 
I n a bid to test their resolve to keep Fàbregas, Milan are ready to offer £27 million to Chelsea, the same figure the Premier League club paid to sign him from Barcelona in 2014 . 
Mourinho remains a huge fan of Fàbregas, having him brought him back to England from Barcelona, and the Portuguese will consider making a move if Chelsea accept a bid from elsewhere for the player. 
Having refused to sell both Nemanja Matic and Willian to United last summer, it seems unlikely Chelsea would agree to do business with Mourinho over Fàbregas. 
Chelsea head coach Antonio Conte wants to sign at least one new midfielder in the summer, but is more likely to bring in another energetic player rather than a like-for-like replacement for Fàbregas. Ever presents 
C onte this month described Fàbregas as a “genius” for his ability to spot passes and create goals, and the former Arsenal captain has surprised a number of people with the way in which he has fought for his place. 
Fàbregas has proved he can make a big impact when starting or from the bench and could expect more opportunities next season with Chelsea set to make a return to the Champions League. 
But his performances have also convinced his suitors, of whom AC are currently leading, that he would be the perfect summer acquisition. Follow Telegraph Football
